definition: a narrow passage through land, a narrow steep-walled canyon or part of a canyon

examples: My gorge rises at the sight of blood.

definition: the entrance into an outwork (such as a bastion) of a fort
a primitive device used instead of a fishhook that consists of an object (such as a piece of bone attached in the middle of a line) easy to swallow but difficult to eject

examples: a river dammed by an ice gorge

definition: the line on the front of a coat or jacket formed by the crease of the lapel and collar
to eat greedily or to repletion, to partake of something in large amounts
to fill completely or to the point of distension
the act or an instance of gorging
